articles.title: Water Stains Around Windows
articles.description: Water intrusion near windows is commonly caused by aging sealant, failed window gaskets, or leaks originating above the window such as marker lights or seams.
initial_checks: Inspect window frame seal for cracks or separation
Check marker lights above the window
Look for streaking indicating water travel

model_year_notes.2017-2025: Marker light and upper seam leaks are frequent contributors

articles.title: Leak Only After Heavy Rain
articles.description: Leaks that occur only during heavy rain usually indicate pressure-driven water entry rather than direct hose-level intrusion.
initial_checks: Identify leak location relative to roof features
Inspect roof seams for cracking or gaps
Check sealant around roof-mounted components

model_year_notes.2010-2018: Sealant shrinkage over time is common
model_year_notes.2019-2025: UV degradation of factory sealant still occurs

articles.title: Marker Light Leaks
articles.description: Marker lights are a common leak point where water can enter and travel unseen inside the wall structure.
initial_checks: Inspect marker light sealant for cracks
Check for discoloration below lights
Ensure mounting screws are secure

model_year_notes.2010-2025: Consistent issue across all modern models

articles.title: Moisture Under Bed or Dinette
articles.description: Moisture in low areas often results from slow leaks or trapped condensation beneath flooring.
common_causes: Water traveling from windows or roof
initial_checks: Determine if moisture is clean or musty
Inspect nearby exterior seams
Check for ongoing dampness

model_year_notes.2016-2025: Improved materials but leaks still migrate

articles.title: Wet Floor Near Entry Door
articles.description: Door seals and surrounding seams experience flex and wear, making them common failure points.
initial_checks: Inspect door gasket for gaps or compression loss
Examine sealant around door frame
Determine if moisture appears after rain or washing

articles.title: White Oxidation or Chalky Residue
articles.description: Aluminum oxidation occurs when protective coatings wear down, producing a chalky white residue.
confirmation: Residue transfers to hand when touched

articles.title: Streaking Below Rivets or Seams
articles.description: Streaking is typically caused by moisture movement carrying dirt or oxidation residue.
initial_checks: Determine if streaks are cosmetic or wet
Inspect sealant condition around rivets

articles.title: Clear Coat Hazing or Failure
articles.description: UV exposure degrades clear coat finishes, leading to hazing, cloudiness, or peeling.

articles.title: Corrosion Around Fasteners
articles.description: Galvanic corrosion occurs where dissimilar metals meet, often accelerated by moisture.
initial_checks: Determine if corrosion is surface-level
Check fastener integrity

model_year_notes.2010-2025: Increases with age and moisture exposure

articles.title: Condensation on Windows or Walls
articles.description: Condensation forms when warm interior air meets cold aluminum surfaces.

articles.title: Musty Smell With No Visible Leak
articles.description: Musty odors often indicate hidden moisture behind panels or under flooring.
initial_checks: Determine when odor began
Check history of leaks

articles.title: Soft Floor Concerns
articles.description: Soft flooring usually indicates ongoing or previous water intrusion and is not considered normal.
initial_checks: Assess whether softness changes after drying
Identify proximity to doors, bathrooms, or windows
